name: 王正豪
objective:
This course introduces the concepts and tools for human information data mining.
The topics include characteristics of human information, application of major data mining techniques such as association rule mining, classification, and clustering for human information processing, and project implementation and presentation.
By considering the characteristics of human-centered information processing, 
students are expected to learn how to observe and analyze the characteristics of human information, and also the major concepts of data mining techniques in the context of human information processing. They are also expected to use practical tools to discover the patterns from human information in homeworks and the term project.
schedule:
1. Course overview: Introduction to Human Information Data Mining
2. Introduction to Characteristics of Human Information
3. Data Preprocessing
4. Frequent Pattern Mining
5. Association Rule Mining
6. Introduction to Data Mining Tools: Weka
7. Case Study - Lab#1: Frequent Pattern Mining Examples
8. Classification: Basic Methods
9. Classification: Advanced Methods
10. Case Study - Lab#2: Classification Examples
11. Midterm (including in-class test)
12. Clustering: Introduction
13. Advanced Clustering Methods
14. Case Study - Lab#3: Clustering Examples
15. Outlier detection
16-18. Term Project Presentation
scorePolicy:
Homework assignments, in-class labs and exercises: ~30-35%
Mid-term exam: ~25-30%
Term project: ~30-35%
materials:
Textbook:
Jiawei Han, Micheline Kamber, and Jian Pei, Data Mining: Concepts and Techniques, 3rd edition, Morgan Kaufmann, 2011.

References:
1. Recent academic papers, tutorials, and slides.
2. Latest news available soon on: http://www.ntut.edu.tw/~jhwang/HIDM/

name: 蔡偉和
objective:
本課程將介紹資料探勘的技術、方法與應用，並以人本資訊處理為主要範例，進行說明，以奠定人本資訊的基礎。課程內容涵蓋人本資訊的特性、資料前處理、資料維度的縮減、屬性/因子/特徵選取、資料關聯、分類與分群技術等。
並將應用實際人本資訊資料做為分析案例，探討資料探勘在人本資訊的應用。
Human-Centered Information and Data Mining is the introductory course of data mining techniques and their applications in human-centered information processing. This course will cover the basic characteristics of human-centered information, data preprocessing, dimension reduction, feature selection, data association, classification, and clustering techniques. Using human-centered information as example cases for data mining, we will investigate the applications of data mining in human-centered information.
schedule:
第一週 課程概述與人本資訊資料探勘簡介
第二週 人本資訊資料特性介紹
第三週 資料前處理 
第四週 Frequent Pattern Mining 
第五週 關聯式規則
第六週 資料探勘工具介紹: Weka 
第七週 資料探勘實例 (Frequent Pattern Mining)
第八週 分類: 基本方法 
第九週 分類: 進階方法
第十週 資料探勘實例 (分類)
第十一週 期中考 (含上機考) 
第十二週 分群: 基本概念
第十三週 進階分群方法
第十四週 資料探勘實例 (分群) 
第十五週 Outlier detection 
第十六週 期末專題分組報告 
第十七週 期末人本資訊資料探勘專題分組報告
第十八週 期末人本資訊資料探勘專題分組報告

Part I: Big Data Analytics concepts & Distributed processing (7 wks)
1. Introduction to big data concepts (1 wk)
2. Introduction to distributed platforms: Hadoop & Spark  (1 wk)
3. MapReduce programming: pairs & stripes, relational algebra (1 wk)
4. More examples: matrix multiplication, similarity (1 wk)
5. Machine Learning Methods: NN, SVM (3 wks)
Midterm exam (1 wk)
Part II: Applications of Big Data Anlaytics (7 wks)
1. Finding Similar Items (1 wk)
2. Mining Data Streams (1 wk)
3. Link Analysis (1 wk)
4. Frequent Itemset (1 wk)
5. Recommendation Systems (1 wk)
6. Social Network Graph Mining (1 wk)
7. Others: Dimensionality Reduction (1 wk)
Term project presentation (3 wks)
scorePolicy:
Homework assignments and programming exercises: ~40%
Mid-term exam: ~25-30%
Term project and presentation: ~30-35%
